subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] edit help
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-167777990-1211856682=:90800
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

yeah that one =)
   
  Can send it over to me in private email if ya want I will run it thru a couple if it will load. I bought the program I liked it so much I wanted to support the future work. An hour is a long time. I usually give them about 30 seconds to talk, they say alot more that way hehehe
   
  Misty

Mick <micksghosts@...> wrote:
          Sorry Charm and thanks. i did find it eventually.

Mick

Pridegrl Neverumind wrote:       Mick,
   
  you do NOT want declicker.
   
  you want deNOISER :)
  the link is here
  http://speechpro.com/eng/company/processing-technologies/
  the top choice says will remove ambient noise from audio files. click on that one. should work- i dont pay for mine in demo version ( you just need to keep files less than 30 seconds each)
  charm

Mick <micksghosts@...> wrote:
      Ok - I am having problems getting the Clearvoice denoiser. It says 'price' and when I click on that a form comes up. I am waiting for an email. It offers a demo of the declicker. So where is it? :-)

Mick

Pridegrl Neverumind wrote:
      Mick,
   
  no problem!
  with denoiser ( make sure you dont get de-clicker) it is simple- 3 steps...
  load file- click clean- click play on the flashy bits and  it will play the original- then the clean version. you can clean moe or less etc as you go....I am new to the program too but its so  easy,  a monkey could do it..
  although ive no idea why monkeys would be editing evps........lol
  Charm

Mick <micksghosts@...> wrote:
      Thanks Charm. I have been using Gold Wave. ACtually I am learning it as I go. I have heard the raw evps' that some people have caught. Then I hear them after they cleaned them up. Allot of background noise has been removed. I thought if anyone could tell me how to remove the noise of the fan, I may get something.

I will check your link out and appreciate the help you offered.

Thanks,

Mick

Pridegrl Neverumind wrote:
      Mick,
   
  a free d/l called clearvoice denoiser works very well
  at 
  www.speechpro.com
   
  other use a program called goldwave
  hope that helps,
  Charm
  

Mick <micksghosts@...> wrote:
      The other night I had a neighbor over. I've know him for two years. I 
have been experimenting with evp for awhile but never really got into it 
until a couple months ago. My neighbor always complains about hearing 
footsteps in his apartment but that there is never anyone there. I live 
above him and have some activity myself. When he stopped the other night 
I asked if while he was here could I put a recorder in his place and he 
said yes. I showed him how to turn it on and he went downstairs. I asked 
that he have everything turned off and he said he did. However, he 
forgot to turn his fan off. I now have over an hours worth of recording 
of a fan running. I just started using Gold Wave. Does anyone - without 
getting to technical - know how to remove the fan?

Any help would be appreciated.

Mick
